mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Will welcome Mr. Correa, but regrets loss of prospect of visit from Short and General Moreau, whom he admires. Relates that both he and Short's farm products are suffering from the British naval blockade and he doubts many of them will ever be marketed to advantage.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1813 April 25, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to [William] Short, n.p.
